subject: SOUTH AFRICAN SIGN LANGUAGE HOME LANGUAGE P2

groups.title: SECTION A: POETRY - PRESCRIBED POETRY
groups.instructions: Answer any TWO of the following questions.

questions.text:
Pace is a dominant poetic feature in this poem. Define and discuss how pace is used in this poem by referring closely to the text in your answer. The length of your essay should be between 2–3 minutes.

POEM WATCH WATCH
FIND FIND WHAT 
PACE P-A-C-E
THIS THIS TOP THIS IMPORTANT 
PACE YOU DEEP EXPLAIN
SIGN YOUR STRUCTURE
TIME 2–3 MINS
questions.scenario: View the poem titled 'Soweto, June 16th' by Modiegi Moime and answer the essay question that follows.

groups.title: SECTION A: POETRY - PRESCRIBED POETRY
groups.instructions: Answer any TWO of the following questions.

questions.text:

THINK FEEL WHAT

groups.title: SECTION B: LONGER STORY - 'ASA STANDS UP FOR HERSELF'
groups.instructions: Answer EITHER QUESTION 6 (essay question) OR QUESTION 7 (contextual question).

questions.text:
Asa, as a naïve, innocent and obedient Deaf girl, comes under the persuasive influence of Mandisa. This leads to the disturbing situation that unfolds for Asa. Critically discuss the internal conflict which the above situation creates within Asa. The length of your essay should be 8–10 minutes.

THIS ASA LIKE-THAT INSIDE ACCEPT ACCEPT GOOD GOOD OBEY
THIS MANDISA INFLUENCE LATER HAPPEN WORST
INTERNAL CONFLICT HER 
DISCUSS DETAIL
TIME 8–10 MINUTES SIGN
questions.scenario: 'ASA STANDS UP FOR HERSELF' produced by the University of Stellenbosch

groups.title: SECTION B: LONGER STORY - 'ASA STANDS UP FOR HERSELF'
groups.instructions: Answer EITHER QUESTION 6 (essay question) OR QUESTION 7 (contextual question).

questions.text:
Place the extract into context. 

EXTRACT BEFORE 
AFTER HAPPEN HAPPEN WHAT

Explain why the father has rules on dating. 

ASA FATHER
DATING RULES THERE 
FATHER DECIDE WHY 
EXPLAIN

Describe Kenzo's behaviour when he arrives.

KENZO CAR DRIVE 
BEHAVIOUR HIS HOW

What would have happened if Asa followed her father's rules?

ASA FATHER HERS RULE THERE 
ASA OBEY DO DO LATER HAPPEN WHAT

With reference to the above extract, discuss Mandisa's negative influence on Asa. Justify your response by considering the story in its entirety. 

EXTRACT STORY THIS 
YOU LOOK EVALUATE MANDISA ASA 
MANDISA INFLUENCE NEGATIVE THIS EXPLAIN

Explain Asa's escape to the bathroom. 

ASA GO TOILET THERE WHY 
EXPLAIN

Explain Asa's emotional state in this extract.

EXTRACT THIS LOOK ASA EMOTIONAL WHY
EXPLAIN

How does Asa's personality contribute to her being harassed? 

ASA THIS PEOPLE THERE EASY LOOK MANIPULATE HARASS LOOK SEXUALLY WHY 
PERSONALITY HERS 
PERSONALITY HARASS LINK HOW

Asa's father is a significant person in her life. Justify your opinion. 

ASA LIFE HERS FATHER VERY IMPORTANT 
OPINION YOURS EXPLAIN

groups.title: SECTION B: LONGER STORY - 'TOGETHER WE'RE STRONG'
groups.instructions: Answer EITHER QUESTION 8 (essay question) OR QUESTION 9 (contextual question).

questions.text:
Albertina is characterised as a courageous, caring and ambitious woman. She comes under the immense oppression of apartheid. The political situation in the country creates conflict. Critically discuss the conflict Albertina experiences. The length of your essay should be 8–10 minutes.

SOUTH AFRICA HISTORY APARTHEID OPPRESS 
ALBERTINA INSIDE STRONG CARE CONFIDENT STAND-UP
ALBERTINA CONFLICT THIS EXPLAIN DETAIL
8–10 MINUTES SIGN
questions.scenario: 'TOGETHER WE'RE STRONG' produced by the University of Stellenbosch

groups.instructions: Answer EITHER QUESTION 8 (essay question) OR QUESTION 9 (contextual question).

questions.text:

EXTRACT BEFORE AFTER 
HAPPEN WHAT

STORY THROUGHOUT ALBERTINA RESIST
ASSERTIVE THIS HOW

EXTRACT BEFORE 
ALBERTINA DO DO THIS 
LINK EXTRACT DREAM ACHIEVE THIS THIS

SHE MOTHER NATION LIKE-THAT 
YOU AGREE

groups.title: SECTION C: DRAMA - 'LIVING ON THE EDGE'
groups.instructions: Answer EITHER QUESTION 10 (essay question) OR QUESTION 11 (contextual question).

questions.text:
Kim is not just a victim of poverty and social inequality. She is also a victim of the insensitivity and ignorance from her peers towards her circumstances. Critically discuss if they truly understood her situation. The length of your essay should be 8–10 minutes.

PERSON THIS KIM POOR SOCIAL EQUALITY NO 
PEOPLE UNIVERSITY THERE LOOK SENSITIVE NO 
IGNORANT 
THEY UNDERSTAND HER DEEP TRUE 
DISCUSS DETAIL
8–10 MINUTES SIGN
questions.scenario: 'LIVING ON THE EDGE' produced by the University of Stellenbosch
